bibl.title: Letter fragment from Henry Rose Carter to Emma Coleman Carter, March 29, 1890

div1.p: Carter writes about the health of his wife, as well as his own health.

div1.head: Letter fragment from Henry Rose Carter to Emma Coleman Carter, March 29, 1890
div1.opener:
MARINE HOSPITAL SERVICE
1798 * U. S. * 1871
U. S. Marine-Hospital Service,
DISTRICT OF THE GULF,
Port of U S Gulf Quarantine, Surgeon's Office,
March 29, 1890.
Dear Ma:
div1.p:
I have to take another trip to Biloxi tomor-
row - a thing I despise & I suppose that the short time
between this & Quarantine will be crammed
full of work - due partly to my unlucky illness.
But it cannot be as full as last year, I have
had no end of trouble with my barges & don't know
when I will get them back,- they are in Biloxi wai-
ting for a tug which has burstted her cylinder.
Time after next I will take the children over so as to get
ashore once before Quarantine. They were ashore Jan/89

An asst. would be of no special use to me now. This ad-
ministrative work can only be done by myself
or some one in charge of the station. It simply cannot
be helped & must be done. It is not that there is too
much to do - only the work has accumulated.
Laura seemed quite sick yesterday
& day before better today but much
weakened by her attack. If it please God
the children will not have it.
I am having all my arrange-
ments broken up by expecting a steamer
for the station. So far as
this one season is concer-
ned I had far rather not have her than
otherwise, I am used to doing without & the fixing
his up selecting over etc will be an enormous amount
of trouble-especially as I will have to throw ababout 1/2 of
my old employee's overboard which I hate to do.
I must confess myself just now as thoroughly dissatis-
fied with my station: thoroughly dissatisfied, I suppose
the mood will pass by about June 1st when I am
fairly at work, If it please God to give us all
good health & keep me from mistakes I will be
very glad. A year is not a great while to bear
anything.

About yourself, be especially careful of exertion & take all the
whiskey you can. Of course exposure is not good, but exer-
tion seems far worse, you need not mind about missing
your exercise. Take small dose say 2 grams of Quinine & toddies
say twice or three times a day, lie down whenever you feel
like it. The weather here has been bad all through March.
